summary.title: Bedrohungsmodell - OTT Auth
summary.description: Die Firma Allsecure betreibt unterschiedliche Anwendungen mit Hilfe einer 2-Faktorauthentifizierung via One-time token, der an das entsprechende Smartphone des Nutzers geschickt wird.

threats.title: DDoS
threats.description:
Ein DDoS Angriff kann den Login-Dienst überlasten und somit für Anwender unerreichbar machen. 

CAPEC-125: Flooding: An adversary consumes the resources of a target by rapidly engaging in a large number of interactions with the target.

ATT&CK: TA0038 - Network Effects: The adversary is trying to intercept or manipulate network traffic to or from a device.

D: 8 / R: 10 / E: 8 / A: 10 / DREA: 36
threats.mitigation:
Firewall, Load-Balancer oder CDN einsetzen, um direkten Datenverkehr auf Login-Server zu begrenzen.

DEFEND: D3-ITF - Inbound Traffic Filtering
ASVS: CWE 770 (8.1.4): Verify the application can detect and alert on abnormal numbers of requests, such as by IP, user, total per hour or day, or whatever makes sense for the application.

D: 4 / R: 10 / E: 4 / A: 10 / Neuer DREA: 28

threats.title: Spoofing of Login Credentials
threats.description:
An attacker can use stolen credentials to impersonate a legitimate user
Attack Vector: "Phishing or credential stuffing."

CAPEC ID: 600 : - An adversary tries known username/password combinations against different systems, applications, or services to gain additional authenticated access.

ID: TA0006: The adversary is trying to steal account names and passwords. Using legitimate credentials can give adversaries access to systems, make them harder to detect, and provide the opportunity to create more accounts to help achieve their goals.

D: 9 / R: 7 / E: 8 / A: 9 / DREA: 33
threats.mitigation:
Description: Use multi-factor authentication (MFA) to require additional verification beyond credentials.
How It Helps: MFA makes stolen credentials alone insufficient for an attacker to log in
Technical: Configure the login system to enforce MFA using time-based one-time passwords (TOTP) or push notifications.
Organizational: Train users on enabling and using MFA securely

-ASVS: V2.2 General Authenticator Security: Authenticator agility is essential to future-proof applications. Refactor application verifiers to allow additional
authenticators as per user preferences, as well as allowing retiring deprecated or unsafe authenticators in an
orderly fashion.

=> Added MFA per OWASP ASVS V2.2 to reduce risk of credential stuffing

D: 6 / R: 4 / E: 5 / A: 9 / DREA: 24

threats.title: Unprotected Key
threats.description:
Statischer key liegt unencrypted on disk. wer zugriff auf den speicher erhalt kann otp erhalten
CAPEC 560: Use of Known Domain Credentials
An adversary guesses or obtains (i.e. steals or purchases) legitimate credentials (e.g. userID/password) to achieve authentication and to perform authorized actions under the guise of an authenticated user or service. 
T1552 Unsecured Credentials
D: 9 R: 6 E: 4 A: 8 Total: 27
threats.mitigation:
Rotation of key instead of using static keys.
MITRE D3-CRO

D: 7 R: 2 E: 2 A: 8 Total 19

threats.title: Spoofing von Kundendaten
threats.description:
Angreifer kann sich als "legitimer" Kunde ausgeben, um an kritische Daten / Dienste zu gelangen zu denen er eigentlich keinen Zugriff haben dürfte (Social Engineering beim Kundendienst).

CAPEC ID: 148: Content Spoofing: An adversary modifies content to make it contain something other than what the original content producer intended while keeping the apparent source of the content unchanged.
Att&ck: T1557 (Adversary-in-the-Middle)

D: 9 / R: 8 / E: 5 / A: 4 / DREA: 26
threats.mitigation:
Personal schulen, Kritische Kundendaten als solche für Mitarbeiter in der Support-Software markieren, um Irrtümer zu vermeiden. 

Defend Matrix: D3-NTCD: Network Traffic Community Deviation
ASVS: 1.8.1 : Verify that all sensitive data is identified and classified into protection levels.

D: 4 / R: 4 / E: 2 / A: 4 / Neuer DREA: 14

threats.title: Tampering with Logs in Log-DB
threats.description:
An attacker could modify or inject log entries to hide malicious activities or create false records.

CAPEC-93: Log Injection-Tampering-Forging: This attack targets the log files of the target host. The attacker injects, manipulates or forges malicious log entries in the log file, allowing them to mislead a log audit, cover traces of attack, or perform other malicious actions.

ATT&CK Tactic: Defense Evasion (TA0005): The adversary is trying to avoid being detected.
Defense Evasion consists of techniques that adversaries use to avoid detection throughout their compromise.

D: 8 / R: 6 / E: 7 / A: 8 / DREA: 29
threats.mitigation:
Description: Implement secure logging mechanisms with integrity checks to prevent log tampering.
How It Helps: Ensures that logs cannot be altered without detection by using cryptographic signing or hash validation.
Technical: Use log integrity verification with tools that cryptographically sign log entries (e.g., syslog with TLS, ELK stack with security plugins).
Organizational: Restrict log access to authorized personnel and periodically review audit logs.

V7.3 Log Protection
7.3.1 Verify that all logging components appropriately encode data to prevent log injection.
7.3.3 Verify that security logs are protected from unauthorized access and modification
7.3.4 Verify that time sources are synchronized to the correct time and time zone.

=> Added cryptographic log integrity checks per OWASP ASVS V7.5 to prevent tampering

D: 5 / R: 3 / E: 4 / A: 8 / DREA: 20

threats.title: Exposure of Sensitive Log Data
threats.description:
An attacker could gain unauthorized access to sensitive log data stored in the Log-DB, such as OTTs and login events
Attack Vector: "Exploitation of weak access controls, unencrypted storage, or misconfigured permissions."

CAPEC ID: CAPEC-180 - Exploiting Incorrectly Configured Access Control Security Levels
An attacker exploits a weakness in the configuration of access controls and is able to bypass the intended protection that these measures guard against and thereby obtain unauthorized access to the system or network.

ATT&CK Tactic: TA0009: - The adversary is trying to gather data of interest to their goal. Collection consists of techniques adversaries may use to gather information and the sources information is collected from that are relevant to following through on the adversary's objectives. 

D: 9 / R: 7 / E: 6 / A: 8 / DREA: 30
threats.mitigation:
Description: Encrypt the Log-DB at rest and enforce strict access controls to prevent unauthorized access.
How It Helps: Encryption ensures that even if an attacker gains access to the database, the sensitive data remains secure. Access controls limit exposure to authorized users only.
Technical: Use database encryption mechanisms
Organizational: Periodically audit database access permissions

D: 4 / R: 3 / E: 2 / A: 8 / DREA: 17

Catalog Reference: OWASP ASVS V8.2:Verify that all cached or temporary copies of sensitive data stored on the server are protected from unauthorized access or purged/invalidated after
the authorized user accesses the sensitive data.

threats.title: DoS Attack on OTT Service
threats.description:
An attacker could overwhelm the OTT service with malicious requests, causing it to become unresponsive to legitimate users
Attack Vector: "Using a botnet to flood the service with requests or exploiting weak rate-limiting mechanisms."

CAPEC-125: Flooding : - An adversary consumes the resources of a target by rapidly engaging in a large number of interactions with the target.

ATT&CK Tactic: Impact (TA0040): The adversary is trying to manipulate, interrupt, or destroy your systems and data.

Impact consists of techniques that adversaries use to disrupt availability or compromise integrity by manipulating business and operational processes. Techniques used for impact can include destroying or tampering with data.

D: 8 / R: 9 / E: 8 / A: 9 / DREA: 34
threats.mitigation:
Description: Implement rate limiting Web Application Firewall (WAF) to prevent flooding attacks.
How It Helps: Rate limiting restricts the number of requests a user or IP can send in a given time frame, reducing the risk of service exhaustion. A WAF filters malicious traffic before it reaches the service.
Technical: Configure API endpoints to apply rate limiting rules  Deploy a WAF to monitor and block abnormal traffic patterns.
Organizational: Monitor WAF logs regularly and test rate limiting policies to ensure effectiveness.

 OWASP ASVS
1.14.1 Verify the segregation of components of differing trust levels through welldefined security controls, firewall rules, API gateways, reverse proxies,
cloud-based security groups, or similar mechanisms.

D: 5 / R: 4 / E: 3 / A: 6 / DREA: 18

represent the process of generating and signing the report.
The report is signed.
The report is protected before being sent.

threats.title: Repudiation of Report Receipt.
threats.description:
the system does not record or verify whether the management has actually received, opened, or reviewed (acknowledged) the exported report.
Attack Vector: "Lack of logging or proof of receipt allows management to deny their involvement."

CAPEC ID: 

ATT&CK Tactic: Collection (TA0009): The adversary is trying to gather data of interest to their goal.
Collection consists of techniques adversaries may use to gather information and the sources information is collected from that are relevant to following through on the adversary's objectives. Frequently, the next goal after collecting data is to either steal (exfiltrate) the data or to use the data to gain more information about the target environment.

D: 7 / R: 6 / E: 6 / A: 5 / DREA: 24
threats.mitigation:
Description: Implement digital signatures for reports and delivery tracking to ensure accountability and proof of receipt.
How It Helps: Digital signatures ensure reports cannot be repudiated or tampered with, while delivery tracking provides a record of when and to whom reports were sent.
Technical: Use email systems with delivery receipt tracking and add digital signatures to reports using tools like PGP or S/MIME.
Organizational: Establish policies requiring management to confirm receipt of critical reports (e.g., automated reply mechanisms).

Catalog Reference: D3FEND: Message Authentication
D3-MAN: Digital Signature
Digital signatures are used to verifying a message is from the expected sender. In email, Secure/Multipurpose Internet Mail Extensions (S/MIME) protocol is typically used to digitally sign messages.

=> Added digital signature validation and delivery tracking per D3FEND to reduce risk of repudiation.

D: 4 / R: 2 / E: 3 / A: 5 / DREA: 14

SIEM 
System
data.description: Monitors the 2FA service and OTT service, generates weekly signed and encrypted reports for management."

threats.title: Privilege Escalation on SIEM System
threats.description:
An attacker could exploit vulnerabilities or use stolen credentials to gain administrative control of the SIEM system
Attack Vector: "Brute force, phishing, or exploiting software vulnerabilities to escalate privileges."

CAPEC-233: Privilege Escalation: An adversary exploits a weakness enabling them to elevate their privilege and perform an action that they are not supposed to be authorized to perform.

ATT&CK Tactic: Privilege Escalation (TA0004): The adversary is trying to gain higher-level permissions.
Privilege Escalation consists of techniques that adversaries use to gain higher-level permissions on a system or network.
D: 10 / R: 6 / E: 7 / A: 9 / DREA: 32
threats.mitigation:
Description: Enforce secure authentication mechanisms and ensure the SIEM software is patched regularly to prevent privilege escalation.
How It Helps: Strong authentication, such as multi-factor authentication (MFA), ensures that attackers cannot escalate privileges by compromising weak credentials. Regular patching addresses known vulnerabilities that could lead to escalation.
Technical: Require MFA for administrative accounts accessing the SIEM system. Configure automatic updates or conduct regular patch audits for the SIEM software.
Organizational: Train system administrators on secure credential management and monitor admin account activity for anomalies.

MASVS-AUTH-3
Control
The app secures sensitive operations with additional authentication.
Some additional form of authentication is often desirable for sensitive actions inside the app. This can be done in different ways (biometric, pin, MFA code generator, email, deep links, etc) and they all need to be implemented securely.

D: 6 / R: 3 / E: 3 / A: 5 / DREA: 17
